cyclone.name: PHILIPPE
cyclone.current_location: about 275 miles SSW of Havana, Cuba
cyclone.trajectory: Accelerating north-northeast across western Cuba this afternoon, through the Straits of Florida tonight, then across the north-western Bahamas and out into the Atlantic away from Florida
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: western Cuba near Isle of Youth / Matanzas province

port.name: Port of Palm Beach District, FL

weather_observation.warning_coast: Cuban provinces from Isla de la Juventud through Villa Clara and the Northwestern Bahamas
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Western and central Cuba, Straits of Florida, South Florida and the Keys, Northwestern and Central Bahamas
weather_observation.wind: Low (4%) chance of sustained tropical-storm-force winds; occasional gusts 25–35 mph possible late Saturday night into early Sunday
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected along the southeast Florida coast near Port of Palm Beach
weather_observation.rainfall: 2–4 inches of rain possible with locally higher amounts; brief urban flooding possible
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated brief tornadoes possible in outer rain-bands
